title: Cytotrexate 10MG Tab 1x10 (L)
details: It is used to treat certain types of Cancer or to Control severe Psoriasis or Rheumatoid arthritis that has not responded to other treatments.
precautions: Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of, Liver disease, Kidney disease, Pulmonary fibrosis, Alcohol use, Suppressed immune system, Blood cell/Bone marrow disorders, Peptic ulcer, Ulcerative colitis, any active infection including Chickenpox or Recent exposure to it), Folic acid deficiency. Methotrexate must not be used during pregnancy, It may harm an unborn baby. It passes into Breast milk and may harm a nursing infant.
effects: Nausea, Vomiting, Stomach pain, Drowsiness, or Dizziness may occur.

title: Nolvadex 10MG Tab 3x10 (L)
details: It is used to treat breast cancer. It is also used to reduce the chances of breast cancer in high-risk patients.
precautions: Before taking it, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of blood clots (e.g., deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, stroke), high cholesterol/triglycerides, limited or no ability to walk (immobility), diabetes, high blood pressure, smoking, cataracts, liver disease. If you have breast cancer that has spread to other parts of the body, you may experience increased bone/cancer pain and/or disease flare-up as you start taking tamoxifen. In some cases, this may be a sign of a good response to the medication. Symptoms include increased bone pain, increased tumor size, or even new tumors. These symptoms usually disappear quickly. In any case, report these symptoms right away to your doctor. Use this medication regularly to get the most benefit from it. To help you remember, take it at the same time(s) each day. Ask your pharmacist or healthcare provider before using any medicine.
effects: Hot flashes, nausea, leg cramps, muscle aches, hair thinning, headache, and numb/tingling skin may occur. A loss of sexual ability/interest may occur in men. If these effects persist or worsen, notify your doctor promptly.

title: Grastin 300MCG Inj 1x1 (P)
details: Filgrastim is used to help your body make more white blood cells.
precautions: During pregnancy and Lactation, this medication should be used only when clearly needed. Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history, especially of Kidney disease, Sickle cell disease, Spleen problems, Radiation treatment.
effects: Aching or pain in the bones and muscles may occur. Redness, Swelling, Itching, or Bruising at the injection site may also occur.

title: Cisplasol 50MG Inj 1x1 (P)
details: Cisplatin is used to treat various types of cancer.
precautions: Use with caution having Kidney disease, Decreased bone marrow function, Anemia, Leukopenia, Thrombocytopenia, Hearing problems, Mineral imbalance, Numbness of arms/legs, Kidney stones, Gout.
effects: Loss of appetite, Diarrhea, Loss of taste. Persistent Nausea and vomiting.

title: Lezra 2.5MG Tab 3x10 (L)
details:
Lezra tablet is used for the treatment of breast cancer, especially in post-menopausal women, which means that the women have experienced the menopause phase. The ingredient which is used in this tablet is Letrozole. The generic category of this

READ MORE
precautions: Before using the medicine, it is important to consult a doctor and share patients’ medical history or any current problem (pregnancy) or any disease.The patient who are hypersensitive should be careful using while using this medicine as it contains some inactive ingredient which may cause a serious allergic reaction.This medication can cause dizziness and fatigue. The patient using this drug should avoid using machinery or drive a vehicle. It can be very risky and dangerous for them.The old ones (aged women) should also use it carefully; they may fall because of dizziness.The patient having a liver problem and having a bone problem should be cautioned while using this drug.Lezra for pregnancyThe tablet is not recommended for pregnant women. As it can harm the baby and can cause birth defects.
effects: Side effectsEvery medicine has its benefit and side effects too. Some of the side effects are serious but rare, but some are very common. It is not important that side effect occur every time, but they may occur.Some of the common side effects which may occur are the:FatigueDry skinConstipationChest painBone problemHair lossDigestion problemVomitingNauseaPain in stomachPain in jointSome of the rare side effects which may occur are the:FeverCoughDecreased in weightBlurred visionHivesIrritation of eyesInsomniaBreathing problemThirstSome of the severe side effects which may occur are:Psychiatric disordersSymptom of the disorder: depressionImmune system disordersSymptom of the disorder: serious allergic reactionMetabolism disordersSymptom of the disorder: decreased appetiteHeart disordersSymptom of the disorder: chest pain, irregular heartbeat, high blood pressureVascular disordersSymptom of the disorder:  a blood clot in an artery, blood clot in the lungsEye disordersSymptom of the disorder: blurred visionSome of the Serious allergic reaction which may occur are: Swelling of the skinErythema multiformeToxic epidermal necrolysisSome of the severe side effects which may occur are the:HepatitisDrowsinessAnxietyCerebral infarctionJaundiceLeukopeniaDecreased appetiteImmediately consult a doctor if the condition of the patient gets worse or unstable

title: Arimidix 1MG Tab 2x14 (L)
details: Anastrozole is used to treat breast cancer in women after menopause. Some breast cancers are made to grow faster by a natural hormone called estrogen. Anastrozole decreases the amount of estrogen the body makes and helps to slow or reverse the growt READ MORE
precautions: Consult a doctor, if you're hypersensitive to any of its ingredients. Keep out of the reach of children. Protect from direct exposure to sunlight, and heat. Store below the room temperature.
effects: Hot flashes, headache, trouble sleeping, dizziness, stomach upset, nausea/vomiting, constipation, diarrhea, loss of appetite, weight gain, tiredness/weakness, increased coughing, or sore throat may occur. If any of these effects last or get worse, tell your doctor or pharmacist promptly.

title: Casodex 50MG Tab 2x14 (L)
details: It is used with another drug (LHRH-type such as leuprolide, goserelin) to treat prostate cancer.
precautions: Before taking bicalutamide, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of liver disease, diabetes, heart disease. Do not increase your dose or use this drug more often or for longer than prescribed. Your condition will not improve any faster, and your risk of serious side effects will increase. This medication may make you more sensitive to the sun. Limit your time in the sun. Avoid tanning booths and sunlamps. Use sunscreen and wear protective clothing when outdoors. Tell your doctor right away if you get sunburned or have skin blisters/redness.
effects: Hot flashes, breast swelling/tenderness/pain, nausea, vomiting, constipation, diarrhea, stomach upset, weight changes, headache, trouble sleeping, drowsiness, or dizziness may occur. If any of these effects last or get worse, tell your doctor or pharmacist promptly.

title: Xeloda 500MG Tab 1x120 (L)
details: Xeloda (capecitabine) is an antineoplastic (anti-cancer) medication used to treat breast cancer and colon or rectum cancer that has spread to other parts of the body.
precautions: Please consult your physician or pharmacist or product package for this information.
effects: severe nausea or vomiting, stomach pain or upset, loss of appetite, numbness or tingling in your hands or feet.
